title.rendered: Portland People Walk Into Trains All the Damn Time

content.rendered:
Things in Portland, Oregon are famously relaxed and the people seem to live calmer lives than in other parts of the country. At least that’s what the city would like the world to think. The truth is, they’re very unaware of things like trains. Their transportation system has had such a problem with pedestrians getting hit by trains that they had to put out this PSA detailing how NOT to get hit by a train.

You wouldn’t think that requires teaching…

title.rendered: Idiot Overtakes Blind Corner, Suffers Immediate Karma

content.rendered: This Thanksgiving edition of the best recent road rage reminds us all to slow down during the busy holiday weekends ahead. We’re all in a hurry to get somewhere, but let’s not become the people in the video above. The highlight of this feature is an aggressive speedster who just can’t stand going slow. Even though this two land road is sporting a double yellow line and there’s a blind corner ahead, they go for it. After almost careening into oncoming traffic, they lose control of their vehicle and crash into the woods. Luckily the patient dashcam owner was kind enough to stop and help them.

title.rendered: Why Can’t This Citroen Concept Be Real!?

content.rendered: Concept cars are seriously weird things. One can come out, on a whim of the auto maker, that gets so much attention that they have no choice but to make it. Other times they lose out to obscurity and never again see the light of day. This Citroen GT falls into the latter. The company had originally decided to make all of 6 of these beauties for around $2.1 million but eventually abandoned their plans. What a shame.

title.rendered: Driver Runs Down Crazed Gunman

content.rendered: After their vehicle was stopped by tire spikes, two men in Queensland, Australia began fleeing police on foot into oncoming traffic on a major highway. A dramatic shootout began as the men opened fire into traffic in a desperate attempt to hijack a new getaway vehicle. One driver refuses to stop and drives directly into the gunman, sending him flying. The criminal leaves his weapon and attempts to flee on foot from the approaching officers. Both gunmen were quickly captured and charged with attempted murder in addition to resisting arrest and evading police officers.

Seriously, never buy anything off craigslist.

title.rendered: The Biker Gang Protecting Veteran Funerals From Protesters

content.rendered:
The Patriot Guard Riders are mostly veterans and they volunteer to provide a motorcycle honor guard to pay respect to fallen soldiers. They began defending funerals against protesters from the Westboro Baptist Church.

Thousands and thousands of volunteers have participated in the Patriot Guard since its foundation.

“We show families in grieving communities that America still cares,” Kurt Mayer, the founder of the Patriot Guard, told a reporter for The New York Times.

title.rendered: How Tough is the New Aluminum Bodied F-150?

content.rendered:
Many have been criticizing Ford for putting out this year’s F-150s in a new aluminum body. Ford says their reinforced aluminum is just as tough as previous bodies but is considerably lighter. While most people tend to think of anything made of aluminum folding like a soda can, Edmunds is here to test just how durable this material is!

They crack it with a sledgehammer and the Ford stands up extremely well! However, it’s the body work that will cost you. It costs nearly $1,200 to fix this panel with aluminum as opposed to the roughly $600 job were it the original material.

Fortunately, he’s the guy who set her up in the first place. Listen, enjoy, laugh, and try not to get too offended.

Stores were sold out and demand was running high. After tons of searching, parents lucky enough to find one for the kids were soon tortured by the toy’s incessant giggling and laughing. It was brutal.

title.rendered: Colorado Carjacker Gets 160 Years for Crime Spree!

content.rendered:
Last year, 30 year-old Ryan Stone led Colorado police on a massive car chase during a crazy carjacking spree. He wound up stealing 3 vehicles in his pursuit including one that had a 4-year-old boy in the backseat! The entire event unfolded on live television. During the chase, he nearly ran over an officer earning him attempted manslaughter felony charges among 10 others! He’s recently been sentenced by a judge to serve the rest of his life in jail to the tune of 160 years!

Watch here as he sits in jail laughing to a female friend about his sudden popularity only to later cry in court as his life as a dirty carjacker ends!

title.rendered: Customer Car Has “Low Oil Light and Rattling”

content.rendered: A customer dropped their 2012 VW turbo off at the mechanic complaining about a rattling noise. They also noticed that the low oil light would always stay on, even after adding MULTIPLE QUARTS of oil, which was odd since the car only had 20,000 miles on it. Turns out the bottom of their car looks like a prop from some Aliens v Transformers crossover movie. The customer had to have seen the massive puddle of oil pooling beneath their car, but apparently they missed it. Either way, the mechanic found the problem almost immediately and expects the final cost to be around $8,000 due to additional damage to the subframe and suspension.

title.rendered: Remove Dents With a Tea Pot

content.rendered: There’s nothing worse than getting a massive dent from a minor bump at a traffic light or in a parking lot. Body shops are expensive, but you may not need spend ANYTHING if your car’s body is plastic. With nothing more than a large kettle of boiling water, he’s able to fix his bumper to near new conditions for the cost of a gallon of water. For those of us working on a tight budget, life hacks like these are priceless.

title.rendered: The Bulldog 4×4 Extreme Is The World’s Most BADASS Fire Truck

content.rendered: The 4×4 firetruck by Howe and Howe Tech is an offroad beast of a brush truck that can pack in more than 2,000 gallons of water. This monster brings the thunder and the rain to any fire, anywhere. It’s all due to the military grade Heavy Expanded Mobility Tactical Truck tires that lift the Bulldog’s chassis more than 2 feet off the ground. This truck has an 80 gallon tank to hold the diesel fuel it needs to carry out those missions that most fire trucks just aren’t cut out for.

title.rendered: Police disguised as homeless to catch texting drivers—Read his sign!

content.rendered:
Montgomery police are using a new method to catch people they think might be texting while driving. They disguised one officer as a homeless man with a sign begging for money.

Here’s the hilarious part. The drivers were paying so little attention to the officer, they didn’t even notice that the sign said, “I am not homeless. I am a Montgomery County Police Officer looking for cell phone texting violations.”

title.rendered: Now THIS is How You End a Car Chase

content.rendered: We don’t know why this guy was running from the police but he drove his SUV to the bitter end! He blows out tires and grinds metal into the highway all before plowing into the median around a bridge then tumbling end over end. Once the car lands on its remaining wheels he just gets out to survey the damage the way one might when they get a fender bender. Of course the police immediately swoop down but they’ll never forgot how calm this guy was for just surviving a brutal accident!

title.rendered: Machete Wielding Maniac Gets Run Over By 2 Cars

content.rendered:
Someone managed to get this extremely unhinged person on film (albeit in portrait mode despite it being 2015). They’re standing in the road, wielding a machete after a fight with other drivers. He even starts swinging on cars that pass him. Two cars decide they’d had enough. The red car tries to back into him but manages to push him in to the path of the white sedan. That’s when this machete wielding maniac pancakes on the hood and gets tossed off.

What’s crazy is that he gets back up like nothing happened! The cops eventually arrive and while the video cuts out he’s quickly detained and arrested.

title.rendered: Mechanic Filmed Crashing Client’s Car

content.rendered:
The driver of this car started up his dash cam when he noticed a Jeep Cherokee driving erratically. Just as he started filming, the Jeep crashed into the side of a mountain right in front of him!

It was later discovered that the Jeep was being driven by a mechanic trying to diagnose the car. He was distracted by using whatever instrument he needed to monitor when he lost control. We don’t think that owner is going to use his garage again!

title.rendered: Redneck Movers – Dodge Dually Hauls a Single Wide Trailer

content.rendered: Sometimes, when you have to act quickly, you don’t have the ability to pick the right tool for the right job – despite what all our fathers taught us. In rural West Virginia these people didn’t have a lot of options available when they needed to move this massive single wide trailer. Enter this Dodge Dually. It looks like he won’t be able to even nudge the thing but sure enough, he gets the job done!

title.rendered: The US Army Has a $2 Million Tow TANK

content.rendered: No one employs heavy duty vehicles quite like the US Armed Forces, but what do they do when something needs a tow? No simple tow truck will do, instead they have a $2 million monster that can tow up to 14 tons. The M88A2 Hercules recovery vehicle is essentially a tow tank featuring a V-12 twin turbo diesel engine and a twin disc XT-1410-5A cross drive transmission. Watch this video to see the Hercules help out a broken down Mine Resistant Ambush Protected vehicle, or MRAP.

title.rendered: Toyota Re-releases Marty McFly’s Dream Truck for This Announcement

content.rendered:
Toyota prepared a special version of the 1985 Tacoma made famous by Michael J. Fox in the film Back to the Future. This custom 2016 Tacoma features the original 1985 Toyota truck exterior paint, off-road suspension, custom front and rear tubular bumpers, light bar, and vintage headlights, taillights, and mudflaps.

They featured the tricked out Tacoma in this special video announcement released on October 21st, 2015, “Back to the Future Day.” It turns out they had another idea in mind, a realistic “Mr. Fusion” in the form of the Mirai, an all new fuel cell vehicle powered by hydrogen processed from landfills. Doc Brown would be proud.

title.rendered: Biker Rescues Kitten From Busy Intersection

content.rendered:
This kitten is extremely lucky the biker was paying attention! While waiting at a busy intersection for her light to turn, this woman noticed a kitten suddenly appear in the middle of traffic! It fell from beneath the undercarriage of a passing red sedan. It took the biker a moment to realize it wasn’t a leaf or some random debris as the kitten ran back and forth completely terrified and confused!

The biker found a moment in traffic to hop off her bike and scoop the kitten up. Luckily there was a kind bystander to hold the kitten while she then moved her bike out of the intersection.

The kitten is now doing fine and staying with the biker who rescued it. It turns out it’s a “he” who’s now named, appropriately enough, Skidmark.

Even GoPro reached out to this traffic hero and is sending her a care package as a thank you for her concern!

The test drive went well and the car has a great history, but it’s not that easy to sell a foreign car in the US when it is set up for foreign roads. The dashboard with metric units and the backwards steering were ultimately a deal breaker.

title.rendered: Lying Driver Hits Truck, Gets Called Out on Dash Cam

content.rendered: Check out the chrome plated balls on this guy. Either he’s a complete idiot or he thinks the driver of the truck is stupid. We assume he took his foot off the brake to play candy crush or some other nonsense when he hits a truck that has been stopped for a good while. Upon reviewing the damage, the fool that caused the bump blatantly tries to pass the blame saying “you reversed into me,” which makes absolutely no sense. The truck driver is taken aback for a moment before pointing to the numerous cameras covering his vehicle. Either he’s brave enough to stick with the lie, or simple enough to take his foot off the brake and assume that it must be the world moving around him since he’s clearly motionless. If you don’t already own a dash cam, you may want to get one because this type of crap could happen anywhere.

title.rendered: BTR-82 Armored Personnel Carrier is an 8×8 Beast

content.rendered: The BTR-82 is an 8×8 wheeled armored personnel carrier built by the Military Industrial Company of Russia. Unveiled in December 2009, it is based on the design of BTR-80A and offers improved protection capabilities. The hull is made of Kevlar laminated synthetic material for added ballistic protection. The reinforced floor offers protection against improvised explosive devices and mines. The spall liners on the interior help protect the crew against explosions.

title.rendered: Cheetah Chases Impala Through a Toyota’s Window

content.rendered:
The Kruger National Park in South Africa is a widely known tourist spot. It’s also known that most of the tourists don’t listen to the rules regarding wildlife. They always leave windows down and get out of the car when potentially dangerous animals are around and sometimes it leads to trouble!

This herd of impalas was running from a hunting cheetah when one of them jumped straight into an open Toyota! He effectively lost the cheetah and the family let him out. That’s one smart, or absurdly lucky, impala!

title.rendered: He Built a Fully Functional Lexus Out of Cardboard

content.rendered: Ruben Marcos, the founder of Scales and Models Company, decided to build a replica for the ages. 1,700 sheets of 10mm cardboard later, they had a fully functioning electric Lexus. It’s not completely cardboard, but it’s pretty close. The car is built on a steel and aluminum frame with an electric engine and functioning headlights, but everything else was just a step away from being a pizza box.

title.rendered: BMW’s Spandex Wrapped Concept Car

content.rendered: This incredible, one-of-a-kind concept from BMW is called the BMW GINA. GINA standing for “Geometry and functions In ‘N’ Adaptations.” It was lead by the automaker’s design head as a way to challenge conventional principles and processes. Aside from the incredibly minimalist design aesthetic, what really makes the car unique is that it’s wrapped in a polyurethane coated spandex that can change the shape and flow of the body depending on speed and exterior conditions.

We have to imagine (and hope) all those brakes are synchronized.

It’s a proposed Flying Fortress (though it likely had a different, more Soviet sounding name) that was designed for years and years during the end of WWII through the height of the Cold War.

While this design never came to fruition during the war, for obvious reasons, many wealthy and adventuring Russians are banding together to try and actually creating a working, flying model of this behemoth!

title.rendered: These Parents Want You to Watch the Last Moments of their Son’s Lives

content.rendered:
This terrifying video shows the final drive and last moments of Kyle Careford, 20, and passenger Michael Owen, 21, right before they crash a Renault Clio and perish in the impact. Both had taken an assortment of drugs before going for a joyride, speeding through residential streets and country roads, hitting speeds of 90 MPH. Even before the fatal crash, you can hear Michael telling Kyle to slow down, but he never does. After the accident, the phone is still recording and you can hear onlookers approach the crash wondering aloud if anyone is still alive.

This chilling footage was released from the Sussex Police department at the request of the victims’ families. Michael’s mother released this statement:

We bring our children up teaching them right from wrong. We guide them and give them our advice and hope they listen, but once they are adults we hope they make the right choices. I really don’t know why the boys chose to do what they did, but I blame them both for the decisions they made on this night.
If all this stops one person from making the same mistake, then some good has come from showing this video. I’m hoping it will have an impact on young people and make them see that a bit of fun can have such devastating consequences.

I would like all the young people out there to take notice and realize that you are not invincible and take seriously how precious your lives are to yourselves and others. I want young drivers to consider how much devastation it causes to the families and loved ones that are left behind.

Watching the video was very upsetting, but I’m hoping it can be used in a positive way, by showing young people what could happen to them.

As horrifying as this video can be, it’s important to the parents of these people that everyone learn from their mistakes, so please pass this along to any young drivers!

title.rendered: Crowdfunded Electric Motorbike Goes Where Motorcycles Can’t

content.rendered: This crowdfunded project by Bolt Motorbikes hit $133,000 in its first day, which is more than half of the necessary funding. Folks are clearly getting excited about this new motorbike that’s more than your average moped. They expect the sticker price on the final product to run around $6,500. This bike can hit 40 mph and go about 50 miles before it needs a recharge. The battery is removable, and can be charged in about 5 hours. Riding this bike requires no license, no registration, and no insurance as it technically falls within the legal range of an “electric bicycle.”

title.rendered: Roads Collapse Beneath Cars, Death Toll Rises in SC

content.rendered:
Authorities are encouraging motorists to stay off the roads, even after rough weather conditions seem to have passed. Nine people have died in South Carolina as a consequence of the sever weather over the first weekend in October, 2015. This road collapsed beneath the truck in the video above, fortunately the driver sustained only minor injuries. The driver in the video below was even luckier when the road collapsed just seconds after their truck drove past. These roads may seem safe on top, but days of heavy flooding from a 1000 year storm have led to unsafe conditions beneath the asphalt. South Carolina Governor Nikki Haley encourages everyone to share this information.

More than 550 roads and bridges have been shut down for rescue and evacuation in the wake of recent storms. Five people have drowned and four more have died on the road in weather related accidents. The risk of road fatalities increases as more roads collapse in the fallout of this historic flood.

The RC masterpiece took 2850 hours to construct and features a 5 speed Cummins engine. This replica doesn’t just look the part, it actually is a fully functioning replica that can do everything a full size Kenworth does. The “model” isn’t cheap though, it’s about half the size at twice the cost.

title.rendered: World’s Largest Earth Mover Gets Demolished With Explosives

content.rendered: The world’s largest earth mover, “Big Muskie,” was demolished marking the end of an era. It moved more earth in its short lifetime than the amount of dirt displaced during the construction of the Panama Canal. After its demolition, it left behind 15,000 tons of scrap metal.

title.rendered: Futuristic Watercraft Makes Waves with Maritime Luxury

content.rendered: From the Italian design studio Lazzarini, this Jet Capsule, a personal watercraft, is essentially a miniature yacht. With multiple engine configurations, total power output can reach up to 600 hp with a top speed of approximately 44 mph. A rooftop deck provides a spot for open air relaxation and the inside is air conditioned. There are also multiple underwater cameras and other luxury amenities like a convertible bedroom, automatic doors, a toilet and can be customized to include a kitchen. This piece of micro luxury shows that it’s not the size of the boat that matters, but how you use it.

title.rendered: The RIOT Wheel

content.rendered: The RIOT in RIOT Wheel stands for Re-Invention of the Wheel and it’s an insane 1,100 pound machine created by Jake Lyall. What makes this monowheel extremely unusual is that it doesn’t use the rider’s weight to counter the engine’s thrust. A separate 450 pound counterweight keeps the rider seated above the ground in the front!

The city was faced with the serious dilemma of having to move the tree when a county road project threatened its existence. The city council hired the Hess Landscaping Company and they only needed a month (and a ton of tractors) to safely relocate the tree!

title.rendered: Flying Cars May Be In Your Garage Sooner Than You Think

content.rendered:
The concept has been around since before the Jetsons were on prime time TV, but the “future” of automobiles just never seems to get here. The Terrafugia TF-X concept is starting to take shape, and it’s more of a question of red tape, regulations, and infrastructure than physics at this point.

The TF-X would seat four passengers and could easily switch between road and air. This electric concept car would feature vertical takeoff and landing, eliminating the need for runways and separating it from previous attempts at gyro-copter/automobile hybrids or the existing airplane/automobile Terrafugia models that exist today.

title.rendered: Amazing Bridge Seems to Stop on an Island, But There’s Really Much More

content.rendered:
This amazing bridge becomes an undersea tunnel, and then a bridge again. The Oresund passageway is main artery between Copenhagen, the capital of Denmark, and Malmo, Sweden’s largest city.

There’s a toll to make this journey, but it’s well worth the cost to experience it in person. Nearly 3.2 million residents have taken this journey since the bridge was built in 2001. The 30 minute commute is a great relief to those travelers who would otherwise take the train or ferry.

content.rendered:
No kidding. This is the world’s largest truck! It’s a massive Dodge Power Wagon. Oil billionaires in the Middle East used regular sized Power Wagons while combing the desert and prospecting for oil. They depended on them so much that one man in particular, Seikh Hamad, commissioned this giant truck in homage to the cars that helped him make his fortune.

It’s a 64:1 model of the original that’s so big it can hold four air conditioned bedrooms, a living room, bathroom and a motorized tailgate that turns into a terrace!

title.rendered: Paul Walker’s Daughter Sues Porsche for Wrongful Death

content.rendered:
Paul Walker’s 16 year old daughter has filed a lawsuit against Porsche for the death of her father. She’s claiming that the police report surrounding the accident was incorrect, and it wasn’t the fact that the car was speeding that caused the crash.

She’s claiming that the car itself careened out of control because it was lacking a stabilizing device that Porsche makes but didn’t include in his particular Carrera GT. She claims that this resulted in the car crashing and breaking apart. The force of the impact broke many of Walker’s ribs and pelvis which trapped him in the passenger seat as the car burned.

This is truly horrific stuff, and refutes the initial report that Walker was killed on impact. Her lawyer also alleges that Walker would be alive today if it weren’t for the “defects” in that model of Porsche, and that the car itself shouldn’t be on the streets.

title.rendered: Richard Petty’s Mustang Sold Twice in One Night for $535k

content.rendered: Richard Petty, “The King” of NASCAR, drove up to a standing ovation at the Mecum Dallas auction. He dropped off his 2015 Ford Mustang GT to be sold on the block with proceeds going to the Paralyzed Veterans of America. No one had any idea just how much of an impact his custom Mustang would make. Petty’s Garage had overhauled the Mustang’s body and powertrain. The car on the block featured a 5.0 liter V8 with 627 hp, a Roush TVS 2300 supercharger, upgraded Wilwood brakes, and aluminum wheels with Continental tires. The suped-up Stang initially sold for $330,000 before the new owner immediately donated it back to the PVA so that it could be sold a second time for another $205,000.

title.rendered: Airless Tires Make Flats a Thing of the Past

content.rendered: Non pneumatic tires, aka “airless tires,” or our favorite TWHEELS could revolutionized off-road and emergency driving. The simple honeycomb lattice design serves the same function as a traditional inflated tire without the risk of punctures or leaks. These tires have a range of applications from off-road enthusiasts to military vehicles. This Dodge Ram 2500 shows what these tires can do on some seriously rough terrain–well no, not seriously rough at all.

It may not be the best way to keep your cabin comfortable, but kudos for the ingenuity.

title.rendered: The Most Powerful Firetruck in the World

content.rendered:
Meet the Big Wind (excuse you). It was originally designed by Hungarian engineers for the decontamination of Cold War era tanks in the event of a CBRN (chemical, biological, radiological and nuclear) attack. With all the power it has behind it is has now found a brand new use: putting out oil well fires.

The Big Wind itself is one part T-34 tank and two parts MiG 21 jet engines! It takes three operators: One driver steers and stops it, another in the rear cabin operates the jet engines that control the water flow and a third stands in front directing the other two!

content.rendered: This video shows the Hennessey Venom GT set a new world record at the John F. Kennedy Space Center. In 2013, the Venom GT set a Guinness World Record for fastest production car from 0-300 kilometres per hour. On February 14, at the shuttle landing strip in Florida, this video shows it unofficially breaking a record. It’s not official because only 16 cars have been sold to date and to qualify, Hennessey must build 30.

As soon as the cop’s lights come on, the biker wastes no time leaving that cop in the dust! Georgia highways are bad enough without bikers running illegal lane splitting, but we can’t argue with out-running a cop who tricked you into a ticket!

title.rendered: Get Scared Into Always Wearing Your Seat Belt

content.rendered:
People still like to complain about having to wear seat belts. Sure, they can be uncomfortable or leave bruises if you are in an accident; however, the alternative is far worse!

Just watch this ’98 Expedition Rollover crash test video. Take a look at what happens to bodies inside a vehicle who aren’t strapped in. As this car, any car for that matter, spins and flips all over the road you can see how easily a human body can fly out the window and even land in the path of the crash!

title.rendered: Volvo Turbo Diesel Looks Like a Nightmare, Drives Like a Dream

content.rendered: This ’82 Volvo may look like it’s seen better days, but once the engine turns over, you’ll know it’s in its prime. It has all the signs of a well loved user mod: paint damage, missing locks, broken blinkers, used tires, and a massive hood exhaust in all its turbo diesel glory. You don’t drive something like this for looks, you drive it for the love of diesel fumes, black grease under your fingernails, and the looks of bystanders as you go roaring by.

title.rendered: Police Seize Corvette in a Drug Bust and Keep it. And Drive it.

content.rendered:
How did this Vette not cost the taxpayers a dime? It was seized during a drug bust.

Greenville Interim Police Chief Ted Sauls has a message for other drug dealers that might be out there: “When you have what I like to call fruit of the poisonous tree, (when you’re doing illegal activity), you can often buy a car like this. The message I want to send is…we’ll take it.” And apparently keep it, drive it, and tell everybody about it.

content.rendered:
The Nurburgring is a well known track that claims dozens of cars each year. Many take their dash cams with them to record their times and work on their racing, but they also get incredible footage of less fortunate and less skilled drivers causing massive wrecks.

This footage shows someone screaming ahead of the cammer as they’ve lost control and slamming into the side wall. The wall then actually pops them up into the air for 15 yards before they hit the ground!

title.rendered: The Most Perfect Bail from a Car In GTA History

content.rendered: Multiplayer modes in Grand Theft Auto 5 can be a little rough. Online, the game is mostly people running around and griefing other players with no mercy. A player in an attack helicopter or jet can really devastate the entire area and prevent other players from ever gaining a foothold. During one particular game, two players in this sedan were trying to outrun an attack chopper when it fired a few heat seeking missiles to bring them down. Once the player in the back knew they were doomed, he elected to try his luck jumping out of a moving car. The result was that he not only survived barely dodging both missiles as they annihilated the car, but he also got the opportunity to seek revenge on the helicopter!

title.rendered: Koenigsegg CEO Races A Bugatti Against His CCXR

content.rendered: Christian von Koenigsegg, founder and CEO of Koenigsegg, goes behind the wheel in a showdown between the CCXR and a Bugatti Veyron on an old airstrip in Ängelholm, Sweden. But there’s a twist, Koenigsegg’s driving the Bugatti. Koenigsegg’s CEO was confident about the CCXR’s 4.7 L V-8 with 1,018 hp and 740 lb-ft of torque. However, even he wasn’t quite ready for the power from the Veyron’s 8.0-liter W-16 with 987 horsepower and 922 lb-ft of torque spread across four wheels. Watch his head snap back as he hits the gas.

title.rendered: How Moto GP Tires Work

content.rendered: There’s plenty of science and engineering that goes into automotive racing. Bridgestone has put together this video detailing how they design the Moto GP tires. These tires have to maintain a steadfast grip on the road through rapid acceleration, breaking and cornering all while collecting absurd levels of heat!

title.rendered: Not the Proper Way to Hook Up a Trailer

content.rendered:
Towing fails are pretty common on America’s roads and highways. We’ve all seen someone trying to pull far more than they ever should in a Honda Civic, or maybe they’re hauling a massive trailer with nothing tied down so all its contents spill out on the road. However, it’s a towing fail like this that’s a rare gem.

This Suburban tied up their trailer hitch to the wrong end of their camper trailer. The weight ratio between the SUV and the camper is all out of proportion. We wonder just how far they’ll get on their trip before realizing their mistake.

title.rendered: Ex-Wife Trashes Brand New Silverado

content.rendered:
We’re not certain what this guy did to piss his ex-wife off so badly, but it had to be awful! The crew at this body shop couldn’t help but document the brutality of her work. She keyed the entire outside of the truck and also covered the exterior and interior in white house paint. She also took keys to his 26″ D’Vinci rims, doused the interior and dash with oil, slashed the seats, trashed the radio, and dumped sugar in the gas tank!

Seriously, don’t piss your wife off.

title.rendered: Fastest Street Legal Dragster Makes History at 251 MPH

content.rendered: Driver Jeff Lutz made history on Day 1 of the 2015 Hot Rod Drag Week with the fastest street legal dragster ever. His Pro Mod 1969 street legal Camaro hit an astonishing 251 mph in 6.05s. This beats the 2014 record made by Tom Bailey at 6.542s seconds, and just barely tucks under Larry Larson’s unofficial pass at 6.16 seconds.

content.rendered:
This dash cam starts after the altercation started. We see the guy from the front car run to his back seat. He comes back, swinging at the other car with a hatchet! At this point, we probably would have run this idiot over. Instead, he backs up.

That’s when the driver in front decides to return to his car but comes out brandishing a hand gun! He fires a few rounds in the tires of the car before taking off. Unbelievable!

title.rendered: Jeep Chief Concept is an Incredible Throwback!

content.rendered: Recent Jeep designs have left us feeling a little underwhelmed. We thoroughly miss the older, vintage look of 70’s era Jeeps. Mark Allen, the head of Jeep design, is here show-off the the beautiful throwback design of the new Jeep Safari. It’s got the classic two door body along with a 3.6-liter V6. It also has a 6 speed manual transmission. This 4X4 is going to turn tons of heads, including ours!

title.rendered: This $6M Ford F750 is an RV in a Pickup Truck

content.rendered: With a $6 million price tag, this may be the world’s most expensive Ford Super Duty F750. It started off with all the basic package, a 6.7 L inline 6 cylinder turbocharged engine with 385 hp and 1,200 lb-ft of torque, but that’s where the standard options end. This wonder was a personal project made by Peter Dunkel of Dunkel Industries. It features a full kitchen, bathroom, dining room, living room with enough space for 6 people, AND it can still carry 4 tons of cargo in the truck bed. Dunkel is clearly going to be the tailgate king this football season.

content.rendered: Florida Man is at it again. This time it was a guy in a truck who was tailgating and harassing a woman driving. He pulls up alongside her and shoots her the finger for a rather long time. She starts to get it all on film while he’s still giving her grief. Then, in an attempt to look hardcore, he pulls out ahead, cuts her off and starts drifting his truck everywhere. The best part is when he fails to maintain control and drives off the road and crashes! Perfect karma!

title.rendered: Cop Lays Down HOV Justice

content.rendered:
Don’t you hate it when you see people cheating in the HOV lane, abusing the honor code and clogging that traffic when they don’t have any additional passengers in their car? Whenever we see someone do that, we hope there’s a cop around the corner to bust them. That’s exactly why this video is so awesome! This SUV sees the cop and tries to merger back in the regular lane, but it’s too late!

You have to give a cop credit who has no fears about stepping out in front of a car on the highway to dole out a ticket!

title.rendered: Bugatti’s Video Game Concept Car Has Become Reality

content.rendered: The Bugatti concept car that thrilled fans in Gran Turismo has just become real. This streamlined luxury super sports car made its real-life debut on Volkswagen Group Night at the 2015 IAA Frankfurt Motor Show. The debut was complete with some fantastic stage tricks that made it appear to be racing along the virtual tracks of Gran Turismo. This concept was built with a singular purpose, to dominate the French Le Mans race track with luxury and style. It’s doubtful that this beauty will grace anything more than a concept show room, but at least its glory can finally be witnessed in the physical world.

title.rendered: The El Camino Returns

content.rendered: Chevy’s El Camino is that iconic half car/half truck that some younger drivers may not remember. Chevrolet ran production on the El Camino twice. The first run was in the 1959-60 model year but only lasted two years. The second run was much more successful and ran from 1964 to 1987. Now, Chevrolet has decided to bring it back, and it’s looking pretty sexy!

title.rendered: Bloodhound Rocket Car Aims for 1,000 MPH Record

content.rendered:
This is the Bloodhound. It’s a supersonic, jet powered car designed to break the land speed record this year and then break 1,000 MPH barrier next year! It’s powered by a jet engine taken from a Euro Fighter Typhoon. Once he hits 300 MPH, three hybrid rockets will fire pushing the car past the sound barrier and beyond 1,000 MPH.

At these dangerous speeds, even the slightest piece of debris kicked up by the tires can tear through the car and cause catastrophic damage. To that end, the car is covered in panels made of millions of tightly woven glass threads. This makes the car practically bulletproof!

title.rendered: Woman Has Insane Reaction to Speeding Ticket

content.rendered:
A woman in Palm Beach County, Florida was pulled over for driving 51 MPH in a school zone! The cop approaches her car and politely explains what’s going to happen…she goes nuts. In most states, speeding 15 MPH over the limit gets you a super speeder ticket which mean the ticket cost goes up exponentially. Compound that with speeding in a school zone, and God only knows how costly that ticket will become.

So when the cop comes back to properly cite her for putting children’s lives in danger, what does she do? She says, plain as day, “No wonder you people get shot.”

We realize there are plenty of stories out there about officers that abuse their position and authority, but for every bad apple, there are countless good ones. We’d love to see this woman lose her license entirely!

title.rendered: Incredible Police Road Rage

content.rendered:
This dash cam video shows an individual traveling on a South Carolina highway with a North Carolina cop playing pace car, preventing him from passing. Eventually, the driver manages to snake around the other lane and pass (on the right). Not long after, the deputy speeds up and gets back in front of our driver! The cop brake checks the car, causing a small collision!

The deputy has since resigned.

title.rendered: Car Owner Stops Thief in His Tracks

content.rendered:
We love seeing justice brought to the lawless. This video shows just that! The black Honda at the pump second from the right has two people in it. While one pumps gas the passenger decides to try and make off with the car parked in front of the gas station. He barely gets it moving when the owner comes out and jumps into the passenger seat to claim what’s his. After some wrestling he forces the perpetrator out as other patrons help subdue him while the police arrive.

The best part is when the thief’s friend sees him in trouble and just leaves him there!

title.rendered: She Slams On the Brakes, Jumps Out, and Terrifies Everyone

content.rendered:
You have reached your final destination!

Posted by CarBuzz on Saturday, September 5, 2015

This video is not a glitch from a video game, someone actually did this. For no apparent reason, this Hyundai driver slams on the brakes and storms out of her vehicle in the middle of a busy 4-lane divided highway. If that wasn’t weird enough, she puts her bag on her shoulder and casually walks along the median as if she just left her house for a midday stroll. Meanwhile, her car, which is still in drive, crosses the median and causes havoc in oncoming traffic. Was she getting revenge on her cheating boyfriend by trashing his car, is she just plain nuts, or both?

title.rendered: Recreating Mad Max’s Original Interceptor Car

content.rendered: Dale Walter fell in love with Max’s post-apocalyptic, wasteland wandering Interceptor when he first watched George Miller’s masterpiece over 30 years ago. The same Interceptor has been featured in every Mad Max film since. Back in 2008, Dale hired the company Mad Max Cars to help convert his 1982 Australian Ford Falcon into Max’s iconic car. It took about $160,000 (in Australian dollars) and 5 years of work to turn it into the Interceptor mirror that has an incredible 450 HP and even has a police PA system!

title.rendered: Reckless Biker Splitting Lanes Eats It Hard

content.rendered:
Lane splitting on a bike is one of the big advantages of a motorcycle in heavy traffic. However, you not only have to be sure you can legally do it (only legal in California), but you have to be EXTREMELY careful.

These two bikers were screaming down a highway in Georgia while illegally lane splitting. Sure enough, disaster strikes. They are moving entirely too fast when a car in front of them changes lanes. The first biker can’t correct in time and completely eats bumper and flies over his handle bars!

title.rendered: Police Chase Ends with Car Crashing Into House

content.rendered:
This police chase was tearing through a residential area when it ended abruptly. Police were after this perpetrator who was on the run because he had narcotics and marijuana on him. As this deputy closed in, the man crashed his truck into the side of someone’s home. He climbed out of the car for a brief foot chase before being run down by the deputy.

That’s not all! The woman you see run from behind the car lived in that house. She was actually in the driveway getting her purse out of a car when the suspect’s crash almost crushed her!

title.rendered: Lamborghini Veneo Roadster Seen in the Wild!

content.rendered:
Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills sees plenty of exotic and super cars, but few are unique as this. Feast your eyes on the Lamborghini Veneno Roadster. When it comes to rare Lamborghinis, this sits pretty high on the list. There were only 9 Veneno Roadster models ever produced alongside 3 hard tops. It’s got a 740 HP, 6.5 liter V-12 and a gorgeous matte black exterior.

SouthBayExotics was lucky enough to capture footage of one roaming Beverly Hills and posted it for all to enjoy!

title.rendered: Idiot Pulls Out in Front of Fire Truck

content.rendered:
The point of view we’re getting is from a fire truck that’s responding to a call. The truck has their lights and sirens going. They are chugging along to save lives and a women pulls out in front of them causing a massive accident. How’d this happen?

First of all, realize that everyone came out of this accident relatively unharmed. That’s pretty incredible when you consider how big that firetruck is and how hard they T-Boned the car. The woman claims that when she pulled up to the stop she heard the siren but couldn’t locate the truck (sun was blinding her). She pulled out and realized all too late that the truck was barreling towards her!

title.rendered: Can This Boat Engined Roadster Take on a Bugatti Chiron?

content.rendered:
Feast your eyes on the incredible Packard Royal Streamliner. This is one of the most unique custom roadsters ever built. Why you ask? Well, it’s powered by a V-12 Packard Royal Streamliner engine that came right out of a WWII era Patrol Torpedo Boat. It’s running off of a 1940’s boat engine technology that can produce a whopping 1,600 HP along with 3,000 feet-pounds of torque! Another way of looking at that is realizing that the Bugatti Chiron is sitting on nearly equivalent numbers!

The Packard Royal is also similar to the new Bugatti when it comes to price. The custom roadster costs a breezy $1,750,000. However, any potential owner to this amazing vehicle gets what they pay for. The roadster comes with two transmissions and two drive-lines. The car is also massive. It measures in at a whopping 32 feet long, much like a boat, and weighs an incredible 13,200 pounds! While the weight and size alone might not let it come close to the speed of a Bugatti, it’d definitely be a car worth owning in a world where money was no object.

title.rendered: Starting a 100-Year-Old Engine with a Tiger Torch

content.rendered:
This beautiful Blackstone Oil Engine was down and out until it was completely cleaned and restored. It was used over 100 years ago to help pump water from a river. Sadly, in the 20s, someone sabotaged it with explosives. It sat partially submerged for several years before being dredged up in the 90s. Someone took the effort to clean it out and re-work the insides.

Now you can see how an engine like this gets started: with a hot bulb, a blow torch and a lot of kerosene!

title.rendered: Massive Trailer Fail with a Huge Gas Tank

content.rendered:
Being able to effectively transport massive cargo is no small feat. Many transportation companies, operators, and drivers make it look simple but that’s just because they’re good at their jobs! Sometimes, workers have to make due with what they’ve got on hand. In the case of this tanker, that wound up spelling failure.

It appears that while trying to back up the sheer size of the gas tank fell over to the ground and brought the whole rig with it. The weight of the tank even wrenches the trailer out from under it and sends it bending itself into the air! It looks like there’s a leak in the tank at the end but we think it might just be a hydraulic system that blew a seal.

title.rendered: Genius Pulls Gun While IN a Police Car!

content.rendered: Police responded to a call where a man appeared to be heavily intoxicated. Instead of throwing him in the drunk tank for public drunkenness, the officers decided to do the guy a solid and simply drive him home. Before they get in the car they pat him down and find more liquor. They confiscate that but still agree to give him a ride. It’s during the ride home that the police hear a metal “CLANK” behind them. They stop the car and find the man has a loaded .38 he somehow got past them! They subdue the man without any shots fired and wind up taking him to jail instead of home. What an Idiot!

title.rendered: Heroic Batman Impersonator Dies After Tragic Accident

content.rendered:
Lenny Robinson was a hero who dressed up as Batman to visit local Baltimore hospitals. He always rode in a black Lamborghini Gallardo made to resemble the iconic Batmobile. Sadly, he was killed this past weekend off Interstate-70 in Maryland.

Lenny was on his way home from a car show in West Virginia when he had to stop “partially in the fast lane” after encountering some engine trouble. While he was looking over his engine, a Toyota Camry side swiped his car, pushing it into him. When paramedics arrived at the scene he was pronounced dead.

Robinson was an internet sensation a few year back when dash cam footage of him being pulled over went viral. It was then that the world found out about his true intentions: his love of helping sick children meet one of their heroes and the joy it brought their families.

Our best thoughts and prayers go out to this caped crusader and his family. Rest in peace Batman.

title.rendered: Ohio State Trooper Saves Trucker’s Life

content.rendered:
This dash cam recorded an Ohio State Trooper responding to a call about a semi that had crashed. When the trooper arrives he notices the cab has been driven off the road and he immediately sprints to see how the driver is.

From there you can hear him talking to the driver, working to keep him alive with CPR as paramedics arrive.

title.rendered: Watch this Lamborghini Get Cut in Half

content.rendered:
You may cringe when you see this but you won’t be nearly as hurt as this guy’s wallet!

This Lamborghini Aventador retailed for around $404,000 dollars when this driver bought it. Now it’s worth much, much less.

He was driving in Brooklyn when someone tried to cut in front of him to make for their driveway. He winds up hitting the car and spinning into the wall around this neighbor’s house. Once the back end clips the wall it completely severs the engine and rear axle from the rest of the car. The wall itself cuts this poor Lambo in two. So sad.

title.rendered: What it’s Like to Take a ’90 Nissan Skyline GTR to a Nissan Dealership for Repairs

content.rendered:
Doug DuMuro over at Japlonik was having a small issue with his treasured 1990 Nissan Skyline GTR. He picked up this import and has taken care of it in all the important import type of ways. However, he noticed that some small piece of plastic had come loose underneath the car and would need to be removed. If you were ever going to trust your Skyline GTR to a dealership service department then this would be the perfect time!

He schedules an appointment and takes it on and shows you right here what it’s like to walk into a Nissan dealership with the most iconic of Nissan cars ever assembled and how the employees react!

title.rendered: Apparently a Good Ride in a Viper is Better Than Sex

content.rendered: So they guys at That Racing Channel have cracked the code of the internet to figure out what gets the most attention. They know individually it’s pictures of cats, videos of fast cars and last, but not least, anything involving a beautiful woman with a low cut top. Take the cats out of the equation and then put some gorgeous women in some supercharged GTRs and Vipers and BOOM…internet gold!
